name: Avoid large Paragraphs - too many Lines of Code
description:
Avoid Paragraphs with more than X Lines of Code.
The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
output:
Associated to each COBOL Paragraph with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The number of LoC
rationale: For maintainability aspect, COBOL Programs should contain a maximum of 100 lines of code.
remediation: Split large paragraphs in a section.
alternativeName: Avoid large Paragraphs - too many Lines of Code

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
